strong evidence to support 
women in choosing home as 
their place of birth. A recent 
systematic review reported 
that when comparing planned 
home with hospital birth, the 
odds of normal labour and 
birth were nearly six times 
as high in a planned home 
birth.	There	is	no	difference	
in the number of intrapartum 
stillbirths (during labour) or 
early (up to seven days) or 
late (up to 28 days) neonatal
